title: Transient ICE after renaming

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Unfortunately I could not minimize the code or reproduce the issue, as this was a transient issue. I should have made a copy of the inrcemental compilation cache, but unfortunately I did not. The issue started occurring after I issued a search and replace over my project. The issue resolved itself after I removed most of my crate while trying to minimize. Because of this I can't really provide a useful example as I do not know where in my crate the issue was. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c commit-date: 2021-11-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.57.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/library/std/src/panicking.rs:517:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/library/core/src/panicking.rs:100:14 2: core::panicking::panic at /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/library/core/src/panicking.rs:50:5 3: ::def_path_hash_to_def_id 4: rustc_middle::dep_graph::dep_node:: for rustc_span::def_id::LocalDefId>::recover 5: rustc_query_impl::query_callbacks::hir_owner::force_from_dep_node 6: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 7: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 8: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::ensure_must_run 9: ::check_match 10: as core::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once 11: rustc_data_structures::sync::par_for_each_in 12: rustc_session::utils::::time 13: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 14: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task 15: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 16: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query 17: ::analysis 18: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 19: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 20: rustc_span::with_source_map 21: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set ```
